intro: Scaphyglottis chocoana, commonly known as the Chocoan piper, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
